methods.name: getVanillaFluidType
methods.description: Returns a vanilla fluid type for the given fluid.

methods.name: getAttributeModifiers
methods.description: Hook to fire ItemAttributeModifierEvent . Modders should use ItemStack.getAttributeModifiers(EquipmentSlot) instead.

methods.name: getProjectile
methods.description: Hook to fire LivingGetProjectileEvent . Returns the ammo to be used.

methods.name: getDefaultCreatorModId
methods.description: Used as the default implementation of IForgeItem.getCreatorModId(net.minecraft.world.item.ItemStack) . Call that method instead.

methods.name: getBurnTime
methods.description: Gets the burn time of this itemstack.

methods.name: modifyLoot
methods.description: All loot table drops should be passed to this function so that mod added effects (e.g. smelting enchantments) can be processed.

methods.name: modifyLoot
methods.description: Handles the modification of loot table drops via the registered Global Loot Modifiers, so that custom effects can be processed. All loot-table generated loot should be passed to this function.

methods.name: getAttributesView
methods.description: FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY, DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY

methods.name: modifyAttributes
methods.description: FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY, DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY

methods.name: prefixNamespace
methods.description: This method is used to prefix the path, where elements of the associated registry are stored, with their namespace, if it is not minecraft This rules conflicts with equal paths out. If for example the mod fancy_cheese adds a registry named cheeses , but the mod awesome_cheese also adds a registry called cheeses , they are going to have the same path cheeses , just with different namespaces. If additional_cheese wants to add additional cheese to awesome_cheese , but not fancy_cheese , it can not differentiate both. Both paths will look like data/additional_cheese/cheeses . The fix, which is applied here prefixes the path of the registry with the namespace, so fancy_cheese 's registry stores its elements in data/<namespace>/fancy_cheese/cheeses and awesome_cheese 's registry stores its elements in data/namespace/awesome_cheese/cheeses
